unnormalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chai-Fueled Chaos to (Slightly More) Calm
normalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Chai-Fueled Chaos to (Slightly More) Calm

unnormalised: So, a few months back, I was the quintessential Delhi girl: fueled by chai, perpetually stressed about deadlines at work, and about as flexible as a concrete pillar. My "wellness routine" consisted of hitting snooze three times and then running late for everything.
normalised: So, a few months back, I was the quintessential Delhi girl: fueled by chai, perpetually stressed about deadlines at work, and about as flexible as a concrete pillar. My "wellness routine" consisted of hitting snooze three times and then running late for everything.

unnormalised: Then, my doctor, Dr. Sharma, gently (okay, maybe not so gently) suggested I try yoga. He said, "Anjali, your back is going to fuse together if you keep sitting hunched over that laptop! Think of it, Beti, a little yoga can do wonders."
normalised: Then, my doctor, Doctor Sharma, gently (okay, maybe not so gently) suggested I try yoga. He said, "Anjali, your back is going to fuse together if you keep sitting hunched over that laptop! Think of it, Beti, a little yoga can do wonders."

unnormalised: Honestly, I was skeptical. I envisioned myself failing miserably in some pretzel-like pose while a bunch of super-fit people judged my attempts. But, remembering Priyanka Chopra's flexibility in "Dil Dhadakne Do" (goals!), I decided to give it a shot.
normalised: Honestly, I was skeptical. I envisioned myself failing miserably in some pretzel-like pose while a bunch of super-fit people judged my attempts. But, remembering Priyanka Chopra's flexibility in "Dil Dhadakne Do" (goals!), I decided to give it a shot.

unnormalised: I started with beginner classes at the Ramdev Yoga Institute nearby. It was... humbling. My downward dog looked more like a sad, drooping cat, and my attempts at balancing were laughable.
normalised: I started with beginner classes at the Ramdev Yoga Institute nearby. It was... humbling. My downward dog looked more like a sad, drooping cat, and my attempts at balancing were laughable.

unnormalised: But, slowly, something shifted. The stiffness in my shoulders started to ease, and the constant headache I carried around like a badge of honour began to fade. I even managed to hold a tree pose for a whole 5 seconds! (Baby steps, people!).
normalised: But, slowly, something shifted. The stiffness in my shoulders started to ease, and the constant headache I carried around like a badge of honour began to fade. I even managed to hold a tree pose for a whole five seconds! (Baby steps, people!).

unnormalised: Now, I'm not saying I'm a yoga guru or anything. I still crave my morning chai and occasionally skip a class to binge-watch Netflix. But incorporating even 15 minutes of daily practice has made a noticeable difference. I'm calmer, more focused, and surprisingly, my back doesn't hurt as much anymore. Maybe Dr. Sharma and Priyanka were onto something...
